content: What's the process for adding new initiatives? We currently only have two, and I know the PMC has to vote on them first, but I can't remember how often they do that, or if any of this is documented anywhere...?
Create a topic on the forums, here: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/initiatives

My understanding of the process is that the PMC can consider an initiative at any time. I don't believe that we specified any timeline or exact process to make that happen.

I would say that you just need to get someone on the PMC to put your proposal forward and it can be considered.

I would recommend that the PMC take time at least once a year to review existing initiatives and consider new ones. I think it's been almost a year since the first two were selected.

So here's what I've been working on today (between family and Bakcdrop release tasks): https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/747

Setup new docs.backdropcms.org website for *all* documentation 路 Issue #747 路 backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
The Idea I made a comment about Backdrop's documentation a while ago. Now I'd like to expand upon it and make an official request for my suggestions... Let's setup a new (Backdrop-power...
There's already a Documentation initiative proposal, so maybe this could/should be part of that...?
And just like the issue number assigned to it, I hope this idea can 'take flight' :smiling_face:
I added a link to this issue to the Documentation initiative proposal in the forum, in case that's useful: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/initiative-proposal-documentation

... I think it's been almost a year since the first two were selected.

It looks like it has been about 8 months: https://forum.backdropcms.org/comment/2064#comment-2064

Now just need to work out if this needs to be an official initiative (in which case, how/when do the PMC decide on that), or if it can just be a regular issue I can start working on... Either way though, I think we'll need the PMC's go-ahead since it effectively involves changing the API site URL from api.backdropcms.org/api/... to docs.backdropcms.org/api/... and then merging in all the other docs.
@jenlampton @klonos I have added this question in the general discussion section of the weekly Dev meeting agenda template (since there's no agenda yet for the next meeting).
